title-group.article-title: The Child With a Hearing Loss
title-group.subtitle: Implications for School Nursing Practice

contrib-group.aff: Director of Health Services Indianapolis, IN

fn.p: Debra has been the Director of Health Services at the Indiana School for the Deaf since 1997. She is currently serves as the Indiana representative for NASN board of directors. She is the parent of a deaf young adult.

Deborah works as the Health Services Coordinator and the lone school nurse where deaf and hard of hearing children are served in regular education classrooms. Her interest in deaf education stems from learning sign language at the age of 12. She is currently serving as the Nevada state director of NASN and is also on the NASN Executive Committee.
